result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco A Serrano

defendant.name: Serrano, Marco A
defendant.address: 515 S. Wisconsin Avenue, Rice Lake, WI 54868

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
(Clerked by RWinger)
Defendant Marco A Serrano in court with attorney Joseph M. Schieffer.  John M O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM302 & 16CM108
15CM302: State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1 and 2. Court orders counts 1 and 2 be dismissed and read-in.
Defendant pleads guilty to count 3. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty.

16CM108: State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court orders the case be dismissed and read-in. $250.00 cash bond to be applied to 15CM302.

Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court.

15CM302 Count 3 :
SW - 2 Years Probation
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold except for Lehman's Supper Club for employment purposes.
Court grants 1 day sentence credit if revoked.
Costs. $250.00 cash bond from 16CM108 to be applied.
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.

(Clerked by APavick)
Defendant Marco A Serrano in court with attorney Elizabeth Jean Smith.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 15CM302 and 16CM108

Both reset to 4/04/16 at 2:45 PM
Bond(s) to continue  Plea hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold, except for employment purposes at Lehman's.

Defendant Marco A Serrano in court with attorney Joseph M. Schieffer on behalf of Atty. Elizabeth Smith.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea of Not Guilty.  Bond set.  $1000 cash already posted ($250 cash bond to be paid out of $1000 posted).  Remainder to be refunded.
  Plea hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
